adjectives.description: multipolar (comparative more multipolar, superlative most multipolar)

entries.meaning: (physics, biology) Having more than two poles. [from 19th c.]
(politics) Of or relating to an international system in which a number of states wield most of the cultural, economic, and political influence. [from 20th c.]
examples: The first diagram reveals a multi-polar system, in which a plurality of forces and interests balance each other in precarious equilibrium.

entries.meaning: An electromagnetic machine in which several magnetic poles exist.
